title: SQL ServerACOS()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerACOS()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the arc cosine of a number:
SELECT ACOS(0.25);

Definition and Usage
The ACOS() function returns the arc cosine of a number.
The specified number must be between -1 to 1, otherwise 
this function returns NULL.
Syntax
ACOS(
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. A numeric value
Technical Details
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2008), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse, Parallel Data Warehouse
More Examples
Example
Return the arc cosine of a number:
SELECT ACOS(-0.8);

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers SQL ServerACOS()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQL ServerACOS()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQL ServerACOS()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
